booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: ['An introduction to computational thinking that traces a genealogy beginning centuries before the digital computer

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: A few decades into the digital era, scientists discovered that thinking in terms of computation made possible an entirely new way of organizing scientific investigation; eventually, every field had a computational branch: computational physics, computational biAn introduction to computational thinking that traces a genealogy beginning centuries before the digital computer

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: A few decades into the digital era, scientists discovered that thinking in terms of computation made possible an entirely new way of organizing scientific investigation; eventually, every field had a computational branch: computational physics, computational biology, computational sociology

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: More recently, "computational thinking" has become part of the K-12 curriculum

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: But what is computational thinking? This volume in the MIT Press Essential Knowledge series offers an accessible overview, tracing a genealogy that begins centuries before digital computers and portraying computational thinking as pioneers of computing have described it

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: The authors explain that computational thinking (CT) is not a set of concepts for programming; it is a way of thinking that is honed through practice: the mental skills for designing computations to do jobs for us, and for explaining and interpreting the world as a complex of information processes

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: Mathematically trained experts (known as "computers") who performed complex calculations as teams engaged in CT long before electronic computers

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: The authors identify six dimensions of today\'s highly developed CT--methods, machines, computing education, software engineering, computational science, and design--and cover each in a chapter

booktitle: Computational Thinking
sentences: Along the way, they debunk inflated claims for CT and computation while making clear the power of CT in all its complexity and multiplicity

booktitle: This View of Life: Completing the Darwinian Revolution
sentences: ['It is widely understood that Charles Darwin\'s theory of evolution completely revolutionized the study of biology

booktitle: This View of Life: Completing the Darwinian Revolution
sentences: Yet, according to David Sloan Wilson, the Darwinian revolution won\'t be truly complete until it is applied more broadly--to everything associated with the words "human," "culture," and "policy

booktitle: This View of Life: Completing the Darwinian Revolution
sentences: "In a series of engaging and insightful examples--from the breedingIt is widely understood that Charles Darwin\'s theory of evolution completely revolutionized the study of biology

booktitle: This View of Life: Completing the Darwinian Revolution
sentences: Yet, according to David Sloan Wilson, the Darwinian revolution won\'t be truly complete until it is applied more broadly--to everything associated with the words "human," "culture," and "policy

booktitle: This View of Life: Completing the Darwinian Revolution
sentences: "In a series of engaging and insightful examples--from the breeding of hens to the timing of cataract surgeries to the organization of an automobile plant--Wilson shows how an evolutionary worldview provides a practical tool kit for understanding not only genetic evolution but also the fast-paced changes that are having an impact on our world and ourselves

booktitle: This View of Life: Completing the Darwinian Revolution
sentences: What emerges is an incredibly empowering argument: If we can become wise managers of evolutionary processes, we can solve the problems of our age at all scales--from the efficacy of our groups to our well-being as individuals to our stewardship of the planet Earth

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: ['Since the end of the second World War, economics professors and classroom textbooks have been telling us that the economy is one big machine that can be effectively regulated by economic experts and tuned by government agencies like the Federal Reserve Board

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: It turns out they were wrong

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: Their equations do not hold up

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: Their policies have not produced the promised resultsSince the end of the second World War, economics professors and classroom textbooks have been telling us that the economy is one big machine that can be effectively regulated by economic experts and tuned by government agencies like the Federal Reserve Board

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: It turns out they were wrong

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: Their equations do not hold up

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: Their policies have not produced the promised results

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: Their interpretations of economic events -- as reported by the media -- are often of-the-mark, and unconvincing

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: A key alternative to the one big machine mindset is to recognize how the economy is instead an evolutionary system, with constantly-changing patterns of specialization and trade

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: This book introduces you to this powerful approach for understanding economic performance

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: By putting specialization at the center of economic analysis, Arnold Kling provides you with new ways to think about issues like sustainability, financial instability, job creation, and inflation

booktitle: Specialization and Trade: A Reintroduction to Economics: An Introduction
sentences: In short, he removes stiff, narrow perspectives and instead provides a full, multi-dimensional perspective on a continually evolving system

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: ['A new theory of how the brain constructs emotions that could revolutionize psychology, health care, law enforcement, and our understanding of the human mind

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Emotions feel automatic, like uncontrollable reactions to things we think and experience

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Scientists have long supported this assumption by claiming that emotions are hardwired in the body or the brain

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Today, however,A new theory of how the brain constructs emotions that could revolutionize psychology, health care, law enforcement, and our understanding of the human mind

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Emotions feel automatic, like uncontrollable reactions to things we think and experience

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Scientists have long supported this assumption by claiming that emotions are hardwired in the body or the brain

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Today, however, the science of emotion is in the midst of a revolution on par with the discovery of relativity in physics and natural selection in biology—ans this paradigm shift has far-reaching implications for us all

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Leading the charge is psychologist and neuroscientist Lisa Feldman Barrett, whose theory of emotion is driving a deeper understanding of the mind and brain, and shedding new light on what it means to be human

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Her research overturns the widely held belief that emotions are housed in different parts of the brain and are universally expressed and recognized

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Instead, she has shown that emotion is constructed in the moment, by core systems that interact across the whole brain, aided by a lifetime of learning

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: This new theory means that you play a much greater role in your emotional life than you ever thought

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Its repercussions are already shaking the foundations not only of psychology but also of medicine, the legal system, child-rearing, meditation, and even airport security

booktitle: How Emotions Are Made: The Secret Life of the Brain
sentences: Why do emotions feel automatic? Does rational thought really control emotion? How does emotion affect disease? How can you make your children more emotionally intelligent? How Emotions Are Made\xa0answers these questions and many more, revealing the latest research and intriguing practical applications of the new science of emotion, mind, and brain

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: ["How humans and technology evolve together in a creative partnership

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: In this book, Edward Ashford Lee makes a bold claim: that the creators of digital technology have an unsurpassed medium for creativity

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Technology has advanced to the point where progress seems limited not by physical constraints but the human imagination

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Writing for both literate technologists and numeraHow humans and technology evolve together in a creative partnership

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: In this book, Edward Ashford Lee makes a bold claim: that the creators of digital technology have an unsurpassed medium for creativity

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Technology has advanced to the point where progress seems limited not by physical constraints but the human imagination

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Writing for both literate technologists and numerate humanists, Lee makes a case for engineering--creating technology--as a deeply intellectual and fundamentally creative process

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Explaining why digital technology has been so transformative and so liberating, Lee argues that the real power of technology stems from its partnership with humans

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Lee explores the ways that engineers use models and abstraction to build inventive artificial worlds and to give us things that we never dreamed of--for example, the ability to carry in our pockets everything humans have ever published

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: But he also attempts to counter the runaway enthusiasm of some technology boosters who claim everything in the physical world is a computation--that even such complex phenomena as human cognition are software operating on digital data

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Lee argues that the evidence for this is weak, and the likelihood that nature has limited itself to processes that conform to today's notion of digital computation is remote

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Lee goes on to argue that artificial intelligence's goal of reproducing human cognitive functions in computers vastly underestimates the potential of computers

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: In his view, technology is coevolving with humans

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: It augments our cognitive and physical capabilities while we nurture, develop, and propagate the technology itself

booktitle: Plato and the Nerd: The Creative Partnership of Humans and Technology
sentences: Complementarity is more likely than competition

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: ["How both logical and emotional reasoning can help us live better in our post-truth worldIn a world where fake news stories change election outcomes, has rationality become futile? In The Art of Logic in an Illogical World, Eugenia Cheng throws a lifeline to readers drowning in the illogic of contemporary life

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: Cheng is a mathematician, so she knows how to make an airtightHow both logical and emotional reasoning can help us live better in our post-truth worldIn a world where fake news stories change election outcomes, has rationality become futile? In The Art of Logic in an Illogical World, Eugenia Cheng throws a lifeline to readers drowning in the illogic of contemporary life

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: Cheng is a mathematician, so she knows how to make an airtight argument

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: But even for her, logic sometimes falls prey to emotion, which is why she still fears flying and eats more cookies than she should

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: If a mathematician can't be logical, what are we to do? In this book, Cheng reveals the inner workings and limitations of logic, and explains why alogic--for example, emotion--is vital to how we think and communicate

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: Cheng shows us how to use logic and alogic together to navigate a world awash in bigotry, mansplaining, and manipulative memes

booktitle: the art of logic in an illogical world
sentences: Insightful, useful, and funny, this essential book is for anyone who wants to think more clearly

booktitle: Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
sentences: ["How will Artificial Intelligence affect crime, war, justice, jobs, society and our very sense of being human? The rise of AI has the potential to transform our future more than any other technology--and there's nobody better qualified or situated to explore that future than Max Tegmark, an MIT professor who's helped mainstream research on how to keep AI beneficial

booktitle: Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
sentences: How canHow will Artificial Intelligence affect crime, war, justice, jobs, society and our very sense of being human? The rise of AI has the potential to transform our future more than any other technology--and there's nobody better qualified or situated to explore that future than Max Tegmark, an MIT professor who's helped mainstream research on how to keep AI beneficial

booktitle: Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
sentences: How can we grow our prosperity through automation without leaving people lacking income or purpose? What career advice should we give today's kids? How can we make future AI systems more robust, so that they do what we want without crashing, malfunctioning or getting hacked? Should we fear an arms race in lethal autonomous weapons? Will machines eventually outsmart us at all tasks, replacing humans on the job market and perhaps altogether? Will AI help life flourish like never before or give us more power than we can handle?What sort of future do you want? This book empowers you to join what may be the most important conversation of our time

booktitle: Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
sentences: It doesn't shy away from the full range of viewpoints or from the most controversial issues--from superintelligence to meaning, consciousness and the ultimate physical limits on life in the cosmos

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: ['With his trademark blend of political history, social science, economics, and pop culture, two-time NYT bestselling author, syndicated columnist, National Review senior editor, and American Enterprise Institute fellow Jonah Goldberg makes the timely case that America and other democracies are in peril as they lose the will to defend the values and institutions that sustainWith his trademark blend of political history, social science, economics, and pop culture, two-time NYT bestselling author, syndicated columnist, National Review senior editor, and American Enterprise Institute fellow Jonah Goldberg makes the timely case that America and other democracies are in peril as they lose the will to defend the values and institutions that sustain freedom and prosperity

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: Instead we are surrendering to populism, nationalism and other forms of tribalism

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: Only once in the last 250,000 years have humans stumbled upon a way to lift ourselves out of the endless cycle of poverty, hunger, and war that defines most of history--in 18th century England when we accidentally discovered the miracle of liberal democratic capitalism

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: As Americans we are doubly blessed that those radical ideas were written into the Constitution, laying the groundwork for our uniquely prosperous society:  - Our rights come from God not from the government

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: - The government belongs to us; we do not belong to the government

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: - The individual is sovereign

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: We are all captains of our own souls

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: - The fruits of our labors belong to us

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: In the last few decades, these political virtues have been turned into vices

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: As we are increasingly taught to view our traditions as a system of oppression, exploitation and "white privilege," the principles of liberty and the rule of law are under attack from left and right

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: At a moment when authoritarianism, tribalism, identity politics, nationalism, and cults of personality are rotting our democracy from within, Goldberg exposes the West\'s suicidal tendencies on both sides of the ideological aisle

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: For the West to survive, we must renew our sense of gratitude for what our civilization has given us and rediscover the ideals that led us out of the bloody muck of the past - or back to the muck we will go

booktitle: Suicide of the West: How the Rebirth of Tribalism, Populism, Nationalism, and Identity Politics Is Destroying American Democracy
sentences: Suicide is painless, liberty takes work

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: ['A lively history seen through the fifty inventions that shaped it most profoundly, by the bestselling author of The Undercover Economist and Messy

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: Who thought up paper money? What was the secret element that made the Gutenberg printing press possible? And what is the connection between The Da Vinci Code and the collapse of Lehman Brothers? Fifty Inventions That Shaped theA lively history seen through the fifty inventions that shaped it most profoundly, by the bestselling author of The Undercover Economist and Messy

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: Who thought up paper money? What was the secret element that made the Gutenberg printing press possible? And what is the connection between The Da Vinci Code and the collapse of Lehman Brothers? Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy paints an epic picture of change in an intimate way by telling the stories of the tools, people, and ideas that had far-reaching consequences for all of us

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: From the plough to artificial intelligence, from Gillette’s disposable razor to IKEA’s Billy bookcase, bestselling author and Financial Times columnist Tim Harford recounts each invention’s own curious, surprising, and memorable story

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: Invention by invention, Harford reflects on how we got here and where we might go next

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: He lays bare often unexpected connections: how the bar code undermined family corner stores, and why the gramophone widened inequality

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: In the process, he introduces characters who developed some of these inventions, profited from them, and were ruined by them, as he traces the principles that helped explain their transformative effects

booktitle: Fifty Inventions That Shaped the Modern Economy
sentences: The result is a wise and witty book of history, economics, and biography

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: ['From one of America’s greatest minds, a journey through psychology, philosophy, and lots of meditation to show how Buddhism holds the key to moral clarity and enduring happiness

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: Robert Wright famously explained in The Moral Animal how evolution shaped the human brain

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: The mind is designed to often delude us, he argued, about ourselves and about the world

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: And it is designeFrom one of America’s greatest minds, a journey through psychology, philosophy, and lots of meditation to show how Buddhism holds the key to moral clarity and enduring happiness

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: Robert Wright famously explained in The Moral Animal how evolution shaped the human brain

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: The mind is designed to often delude us, he argued, about ourselves and about the world

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: And it is designed to make happiness hard to sustain

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: But if we know our minds are rigged for anxiety, depression, anger, and greed, what do we do? Wright locates the answer in Buddhism, which figured out thousands of years ago what scientists are only discovering now

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: Buddhism holds that human suffering is a result of not seeing the world clearly—and proposes that seeing the world more clearly, through meditation, will make us better, happier people

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: In Why Buddhism is True, Wright leads readers on a journey through psychology, philosophy, and a great many silent retreats to show how and why meditation can serve as the foundation for a spiritual life in a secular age

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: At once excitingly ambitious and wittily accessible, this is the first book to combine evolutionary psychology with cutting-edge neuroscience to defend the radical claims at the heart of Buddhist philosophy

booktitle: Why Buddhism is True: The Science and Philosophy of Meditation and Enlightenment
sentences: With bracing honesty and fierce wisdom, it will persuade you not just that Buddhism is true—which is to say, a way out of our delusion—but that it can ultimately save us from ourselves, as individuals and as a species
